Inside HHS Rule On Test Results From HIPAA-Covered Labs

Law360, New York (February 24, 2014, 5:41 PM ET) -- On Feb. 6, the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services published a final rule amending the Clinical Laboratory Improvement Amendments of 1988 ("CLIA") regulations and the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act of 1996 ("HIPAA") regulations to permit CLIA-certified laboratories to provide copies of completed test reports to patients (or their representatives) upon request. article_metadata.description: The U.S. Department of Health and Human Services' recently published final rule permitting Clinical Laboratory Improvement Amendments-certified laboratories to provide completed test reports to patients is a significant departure from past policy, as HHS has generally deferred to state law on whether laboratories can release test results directly to patients, say Helen Pfister and Michelle McGovern of Manatt Phelps and Phillips LLP.
